title: [Bug] No tracking protection icon shown after clicking on "report site issue"
body:
## Steps to reproduce
* Go to a website
* Click on menu ~~> addons~~ > Report site issue

### Expected behavior
* Tracking protection icon showing in toolbar

### Actual behavior
* No tracking protection icon in toolbar (empty space)
* Also doesn't appear when navigating in the tab or reloading the page

### Device information
* Android device: Pixel 3, Android 10
* Fenix version: Nightly 200723

node.body:
This just happened on twitter.com and HuffPost for me on a fresh install with default settings, no clear STR. Also, the ETP toggle appears as turned off on that website.

I also reproduced this bug on this test page: https://senglehardt.com/test/trackingprotection/test_pages/social_tracking_protection_and_cryptomining.html

All strict mode UI tests are failing because the ETP is off/not blocking, see https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/fenix/issues/14524

node.body:
While I haven't been able to reproduce the issue with "Dark Reader" I have been able to consistently reproduce it with **"Report Site Issue..."** option from the 3 dot menu.

Opening a new tab normally would trigger in `EngineObserver`:
```
    override fun onTrackerBlockingEnabledChange(enabled: Boolean) {
        session.trackerBlockingEnabled = enabled
    }
```
which itself gets called from `GeckoEngineSession`, however when using **"Report Site Issue..."** this workflow is bypassed and that new _"webcompat.com/issues/new"_ tab is left with `SiteTrackingProtection.OFF_GLOBALLY`

I'm not yet sure why this happens, but if anyone from the GV team has any input I could really use it. 
Adding _needs-gv_ for myself here.



**Edit:** While inside the "webcomat.com" tab, if you navigate to a different URL ETP still doesn't show up.

node.body:
As I mentioned on the slack chat, [here](https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/android-components/blob/9673de174eefa9fa957c351877c3ea3de3de5caf/components/feature/toolbar/src/main/java/mozilla/components/feature/toolbar/ToolbarPresenter.kt#L74) is where we are observing the session and changing which status the icon should have, when the status is set then this class [TrackingProtectionIconView](https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/android-components/blob/master/components/browser/toolbar/src/main/java/mozilla/components/browser/toolbar/display/TrackingProtectionIconView.kt) is in charge of [changing to the right icon or showing/hiding it](https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/android-components/blob/9673de174eefa9fa957c351877c3ea3de3de5caf/components/browser/toolbar/src/main/java/mozilla/components/browser/toolbar/display/TrackingProtectionIconView.kt#L37).

Something that found a bit strange is that the icon is showing while there is not any drawable or tint set:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/773158/106152550-8f53b000-614b-11eb-8d81-eac0828dc08a.png)


That could be an inconsistent  state where the toolbar gets initialized but  [TrackingProtectionIconView.kt](https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/android-components/blob/9673de174eefa9fa957c351877c3ea3de3de5caf/components/browser/toolbar/src/main/java/mozilla/components/browser/toolbar/display/TrackingProtectionIconView.kt#L121) doesn't get called to apply the right configuration. I think you could debug [SiteTrackingProtection.toUpdate()](https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/android-components/blob/9673de174eefa9fa957c351877c3ea3de3de5caf/components/browser/toolbar/src/main/java/mozilla/components/browser/toolbar/display/TrackingProtectionIconView.kt#L103) function when you click to the "Report Site Issue..." button to see if `SiteTrackingProtection.toUpdate()` gets executed  if not we have to investigate why not, because it should.  Please let me know if you need any additional help happy help :) .
node.bodyText:
As I mentioned on the slack chat, here is where we are observing the session and changing which status the icon should have, when the status is set then this class TrackingProtectionIconView is in charge of changing to the right icon or showing/hiding it.
Something that found a bit strange is that the icon is showing while there is not any drawable or tint set:

That could be an inconsistent  state where the toolbar gets initialized but  TrackingProtectionIconView.kt doesn't get called to apply the right configuration. I think you could debug SiteTrackingProtection.toUpdate() function when you click to the "Report Site Issue..." button to see if SiteTrackingProtection.toUpdate() gets executed  if not we have to investigate why not, because it should.  Please let me know if you need any additional help happy help :) .

I think you could debug SiteTrackingProtection.toUpdate() function when you click to the "Report Site Issue..." button to see if SiteTrackingProtection.toUpdate() gets executed  if not we have to investigate why not, because it should.
Please let me know if you need any additional help happy help :) .

node.body:
Still working on this but I'm gonna jot down a few things I noticed, because I stopped too soon with my debugging when I wrote my previous comment.

- Both normal tabs and "Report Site Issue" tab go through `GeckoEngineSession.createGeckoSession(...)`. However normal tabs have `defaultSettings` non-null (as they are initialised in `Core.kt`) while "Report Site Issue" has it null, leading to the issue we can see in the above posted screenshots.
- `defaultSettings` is null for "Report Site Issue" as they are not populated as a parameter when calling `GeckoWebExtension.registerTabHandler(..) -> override fun onNewTab(...)` ([link](https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/android-components/blob/a8a28338fb939d581ad62fad55cd8b6fa3bc1bc0/components/browser/engine-gecko-nightly/src/main/java/mozilla/components/browser/engine/gecko/webextension/GeckoWebExtension.kt#L255))
- Adding a `DefaultSettings(trackingProtectionPolicy = TrackingProtectionPolicy.none())` as a parameter to `GeckoEngineSession` initialisation from the previously mentioned `onNewTab(..)` fixes the issue, however I don't believe that's ok. I think we should let Fenix control this by passing user preferences regarding ETP to `GeckoWebExtension`. I'll look into this solution.


> Something that found a bit strange is that the icon is showing while there is not any drawable or tint set

I didn't look into that yet, but that may be a better and simpler solution: no ETP settings -> don't show the ETP icon "space".

defaultSettings is null for "Report Site Issue" as they are not populated as a parameter when calling GeckoWebExtension.registerTabHandler(..) -> override fun onNewTab(...) (link)
Adding a DefaultSettings(trackingProtectionPolicy = TrackingProtectionPolicy.none()) as a parameter to GeckoEngineSession initialisation from the previously mentioned onNewTab(..) fixes the issue, however I don't believe that's ok.   • Both normal tabs and "Report Site Issue" tab go through GeckoEngineSession.createGeckoSession(...). However normal tabs have defaultSettings non-null (as they are initialised in Core.kt) while "Report Site Issue" has it null, leading to the issue we can see in the above posted screenshots.
  • defaultSettings is null for "Report Site Issue" as they are not populated as a parameter when calling GeckoWebExtension.registerTabHandler(..) -> override fun onNewTab(...) (link)
  • Adding a DefaultSettings(trackingProtectionPolicy = TrackingProtectionPolicy.none()) as a parameter to GeckoEngineSession initialisation from the previously mentioned onNewTab(..) fixes the issue, however I don't believe that's ok. defaultSettings is null for "Report Site Issue" as they are not populated as a parameter when calling GeckoWebExtension.registerTabHandler(..) -> override fun onNewTab(...) (link)

node.body:
Went with `defaultSettings` added to `GeckoWebExtension.registerTabHandler(..) -> override fun onNewTab(...)` by using the ones from `GeckoEngine` when calling  `installedExtension.registerTabHandler(webExtensionTabHandler, +defaultSettings+)`

Thank you @Mugurell for all your help with this.❤️ 

Will be fixed by PR https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/android-components/pull/9607
